title: Get Products Request
description: Request parameters for discovering or refining advertising products. buying_mode declares the buyer's intent: 'brief' for curated discovery, 'wholesale' for raw catalog access, or 'refine' to iterate on known products.

buying_mode.description: Declares buyer intent for this request. 'brief': publisher curates product recommendations from the provided brief. 'wholesale': buyer requests raw inventory to apply their own audiences — brief must not be provided, and proposals are omitted. 'refine': iterate on known products or proposals from a previous get_products response — requires at least one of product_ids or proposal_id. The seller returns updated forecasts, pricing, and product configurations reflecting the new brief and/or filters.

brief.description: Natural language description of campaign requirements. Required when buying_mode is 'brief'. Must not be provided when buying_mode is 'wholesale'. When buying_mode is 'refine', provides context for what changed (e.g., 'Increase budget to $200k and narrow to California only').

product_ids.description: Product IDs from a previous get_products response. The seller skips discovery and returns only these products with updated forecasts, pricing, and package configurations reflecting the current brief and filters. At least one of product_ids or proposal_id is required when buying_mode is 'refine'.

proposal_id.description: Proposal ID from a previous get_products response. The seller returns an updated version of this proposal with revised forecasts, allocations, and pricing reflecting the current brief and filters. At least one of product_ids or proposal_id is required when buying_mode is 'refine'. When both are provided, product_ids narrow or expand the proposal's product set.

brand.description: Brand reference for product discovery context. Resolved to full brand identity at execution time.

catalog.description: Catalog of items the buyer wants to promote. The seller matches catalog items against its inventory and returns products where matches exist. Supports all catalog types: a job catalog finds job ad products, a product catalog finds sponsored product slots. Reference a synced catalog by catalog_id, or provide inline items.

account.description: Account for product lookup. Returns products with pricing specific to this account's rate card.

buyer_campaign_ref.description: Buyer's campaign reference label. Groups related discovery and buy operations under a single campaign for CRM and ad server correlation (e.g., 'NovaDrink_Meals_Q2').

property_list.description: [AdCP 3.0] Reference to an externally managed property list. When provided, the sales agent should filter products to only those available on properties in the list.
